topstory: Scientists 'delete' HIV virus from human DNA for the first time
snippet: It inserts its deadly genome permanently into its victims' DNA, forcing them to be hooked on drugs for life. But now, for the first time, researchers in Philadelphia have found a way to completely delete HIV from human cells by 'snipping' them out.
